headline.main: SPY SUSPECT CITES LOSS OF REICH JOB; Former Director of Ford Unit Says He Was Attacked as 'Too American'

lead_paragraph: An alleged German espionage agent took the witness stand in his own behalf yesterday at the espionage trial in Brooklyn and testified that his devotion to the country of his adoption, the United States, had cost him his $30,000-a-year position as managing director of the Ford Motor Company In Germany.
abstract: E C Heine testifies his U S citizenship caused job loss as Ford Co dir in Germany
